subject: Test Results with Exception Handling
msgSnippet: I ve read the current Best Practices and search the group archives for related articles but I am still confused. I would appreciate your indulgence. Should a
messageBody:
I've read the current Best Practices and search the group archives for
related articles but I am still confused. I would appreciate your
indulgence.

Should a test case return a success or failure on a method when it throws an
exception. Specifically, I have a method that loads environment variables
from a source file. If the file is not found, the method throws a
FileNotFoundException. Now the test case has a try/catch block to trap the
exception but should I fail the test if caught.

Currently, my thinking is the test case passes because the method did in
fact function correctly. The code is written to throw an error. However,
reading the articles on the subject I am confused. Should the test case
re-throw the exception? Report a failure? Report a success but output a
message the test case was inconclusive?

Thanks.
